Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Propofol's Immunomodulatory Effects in Sepsis

Trial_Design.evidence: In this randomised controlled trial, macrophages from Rab5a−/− and WT mice were treated

Participants.evidence: Peripheral blood monocytes from septic patients and healthy volunteers were also analyzed.

Intervention.evidence: macrophages from Rab5a−/− and WT mice were treated with lipopolysaccharide (LPS) or cecal ligation and puncture (CLP)

Objective.evidence: This study aims to elucidate the mechanisms of propofol's immunomodulatory activity.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in membrane TLR4 expression, assessed over 24 hours.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation concealment was achieved using sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Outcome assessors were blinded to group assignments.

Result_Outcome.evidence: Propofol significantly reduced membrane TLR4 expression on macrophages in both in vitro and in vivo settings.

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported during the study.
